item.title: Jeff add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "He attacked everything in life with a mix of extraordinary genius and naive incompetence, and it was often difficult to tell which was which." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Ender nodded. It was a lie, of course, that it wouldn’t hurt a bit. But since adults always said it when it was going to hurt, he could count on that statement as an accurate prediction of the future. Sometimes lies were more dependable than the truth." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "She was a dull person, but a sensational invitation to make babies." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I am a humanist, which means, in part, that I have tried to behave decently without expectations of rewards or punishments after I am dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "What I need... is a strong drink and a peer group." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jeff add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "when you're not looking, somebody'll sneak up and write "Fuck you" right under your nose." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I wish I had more friends, but people are such jerks. If you can just get most people to leave you alone, you're doing good. If you can find even one person you really like, you're lucky. And if that person can also stand you, you're really lucky." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "To me, making a tape is like writing a letter – there's a lot of erasing and rethinking and starting again, and I wanted it to be a good one." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "First comes smiles, then lies. Last is gunfire.-Roland Deschain, of Gilead" -- Stephen King

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Nobody's perfect. Well, there was this one guy, but we killed him...." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "My faith is whatever makes me feel good about being alive. If your religion doesn't make you feel good to be alive, what the hell is the point of it?" -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We could have saved [the Earth] but we were too damned cheap." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Jeff add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Love is where you find it. I think it is foolish to go around looking for it, and I think it can be poisonous. I wish that people who are conventionally supposed to love each other would say to each other, when they fight, 'Please — a little less love, and a little more common decency'." -- Kurt Vonnegut
